item.title: Portfwording help
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“zane01, post:13, topic:262653”]paying for portforward.com is best for a beginner, then they can learn later. 100s of people do dumb things like portforwarding when they are clueless and screw up there pc. (i was one of them lol)

Once you have them doing it for you, you can learn on your own time. Or you can study the site until your ready for portforwarding.

Sometimes when you portforward and mess up you will need to basicly restart all your files and delete tons of junk.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2009, 09:04:53 pm[/size][hr][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=346817.msg2671513#msg2671513 date=1234839798]

Well if you really cant portforward, then trying to can really screw up your computer. You should either use portforward.com and read about it and do it manually.

Or

Go to portforward.com and pay for them to portforward for you. (this way you can never do it wrong, but it will cost you)

Portforwarding can’t mess up your computer.
[/quote]

Yes it can, it can change the java path. Which makes it where you cant use runescape/silabscape/or moparscape. Its happen to me in the past. (but it is fixable :D)[/quote]
Lol, no it can’t. Portforwarding is opening ports that allow connections, it has nothing to do with Class paths.

Read full topic

item.title: Portfwording help
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

It can only mess up your routers connection setting (happened to me). My service was disabled because they thought i was trying to steal internet or something… Never heard of it restarting your files…

Read full topic

paying for portforward.com is best for a beginner, then they can learn later. 100s of people do dumb things like portforwarding when they are clueless and screw up there pc. (i was one of them lol)

Well if you really cant portforward, then trying to can really screw up your computer. You should either use portforward.com and read about it and do it manually.

Or

Go to portforward.com and pay for them to portforward for you. (this way you can never do it wrong, but it will cost you)
[/quote]
Portforwarding can’t mess up your computer.[/quote]

Yes it can, it can change the java path. Which makes it where you cant use runescape/silabscape/or moparscape. Its happen to me in the past. (but it is fixable :D)

item.title: Portfwording help
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

dogzound5@gmail.com:

Isn’t there a way the staff could open up another section for portforwarding? A lot of people need help and the guides on portforward.com can be confusing not really but a lot of noobs out there need some noobish help. lol. HECK!! Noobs go take some computer classes!!

No, there are tutorials that have portforwarding tutorials within them. A portforwarding help section would be pointless; everyone would be asking the same questions. That is why a section would be useless, and that is why it is against the rules to ask about portforwarding here.

Read full topic

item.title: Portfwording help
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

Open up your browser and type in your default gateway address and go to your router’s setup page. It is different on all routers but there should be a firewall section and under that some type of portforwarding. And in that section you put in your port to be forwarded. If you have a modem you have to port forward that too.

Read full topic
